result.execSummary:
On one or more charges in this case, Daniel J Plier was found not guilty by reason of mental disease or defect. The defendant was found guilty of actually committing the crime(s) charged, but was also found not to be legally responsible under Wis. Stats. 971.165 for committing the crime(s) because of the defendant's mental condition. The legal effect of a finding of not guilty by reason of mental disease or defect is that the court must commit the defendant to the custody of the Department of Health and Family Services.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

(Not Guilty by Reason of Mental Disease or Defect)
Hearing on December 12, 2014 at 09:00 am.

Def in person & by Atty Eileen T. Evans.  Atty Peter John Cannon appeared for State.  Case recalled.  State stipulates to finding of NGI.  Plea questionnaire filed.  Guilty plea entered on Cts. 1 and 2.  Court finds Defendant not guilty by reason of mental disease or defect as to Ct. 1 and Ct. 2.  Court orders judgment of NGI be entered and orders Defendant committed to Department of Health Services on Ct. 1 for 60 day duration and 3 years duration on Ct. 2 commencing forthwith; Defendant is entitled to 42 days credit.  Court finds Defendant resides in Washington County and based on the report of Dr. Pankiewicz that conditional release would not pose a threat to the community.  Court orders DHS to prepare a conditional release plan and plan to be presented to Court within 21 days.  Hearing scheduled for December 12, 2014 at 09:00 am.
Def in person & by Atty Eileen T. Evans.  Atty Peter John Cannon appeared for State.  Report previously filed by Dr. Pankiewicz; case passed.

Def appears in person in custody.  Atty Sandra Jo Giernoth for State.  Clerk: MS;   Def given complaint, advised of charges, penalties and rights, and probable cause found. Court sets $500 cash bond. Def has representation in pending case; Def does not waive his right to a speedy preliminary hearing.  Def requests to plead not guilty, Court does not accept plea at this time.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 30, 2014 at 02:30 pm.

Def appears in person in custody via video conference from the WA Cty Jail.  Atty Peter John Cannon for State.  Defendant is refusing to be brought to video conference room; defendant is set to be transported to Winnebago this afternoon. Court finds probable cause and orders a warrant.
